alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:38PM EST until December 20 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. For the Piscataquis River...including Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River at Medford. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Medford Road between Alder Brook to Robin Hollow Drive. Minor flooding along the lowland areas from Trestle Road Bridge downstream to Maxfield townline. Minor flooding along River Road and North Howland Road to I-95 Bridge in Maxfield to Howland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - At 12.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EST Tuesday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later tonight and continue falling to 6.1 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 12/22/1973. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at midnight EST.
